statements.name: PROC ESM
statements.description: The ESM procedure generates forecasts by using exponential smoothing models with optimized smoothing weights for many time series or transactional data. † For typical time series, you can use the following smoothing models: o simple o double o linear o damped trend o seasonal o Winters method (additive and multiplicative) † Additionally, transformed versions of these models are provided: o log o square root o logistic o Box-Cox

arguments.name: BACK=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of observations before the end of the data where the multistep forecasts are to begin. The default is BACK=0.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set that contains the input data for the procedure to forecast. If the DATA= option is not specified, the most recently created SAS data set is used.

arguments.name: LEAD=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of periods ahead to forecast (forecast lead or horizon).

arguments.name: MAXERROR=
arguments.description: Limits the number of warning and error messages produced during the execution of the procedure to the specified value. The default is MAXERRORS=50. This option is particularly useful in BY-group processing where it can be used to suppress the recurring messages.

arguments.name: NOOUTALL
arguments.description: Specifies that only forecasts are written to the OUT= and OUTFOR= data sets.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the forecasts of the variables specified in the subsequent FORECAST statements. If an ID variable is specified, it is also included in the OUT= data set. The values are accumulated based on the ACCUMULATE= option, and forecasts are appended to these values based on the FORECAST statement USE= option.

arguments.name: OUTEST=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the model parameter estimates and the associated test statistics and probability values. The OUTEST= data set is useful for evaluating the significance of the model parameters and understanding the model dynamics.

arguments.name: OUTFOR=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the forecast time series components (actual, predicted, lower confidence limit, upper confidence limit, prediction error, prediction standard error). The OUTFOR= data set is useful for displaying the forecasts in tabular or graphical form.

arguments.name: OUTPROCINFO=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain information in the SAS log, specifically the number of notes, errors, and warnings and the number of series processed, forecasts requested, and forecasts failed.

arguments.name: OUTSTAT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the statistics of fit (or goodness-of-fit statistics). The OUTSTAT= data set is useful for evaluating how well the model fits the series.

arguments.name: OUTSUM=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the summary statistics and the forecast summation.

arguments.name: PLOT=
arguments.description: Specifies the graphical output desired. By default, the ESM procedure produces no graphical output.
arguments.help: PLOT=ERRORS | ACF | PACF | IACF | WN | MODELS | FORECASTS | MODELFORECASTSONLY | FORECASTSONLY | LEVELS | SEASONS | TRENDS | ALL

arguments.name: ERRORS
arguments.description: Plots prediction error time series graphics.

arguments.name: ACF
arguments.description: Plots prediction error autocorrelation function graphics.

arguments.name: PACF
arguments.description: Plots prediction error partial autocorrelation function graphics.

arguments.name: IACF
arguments.description: Plots prediction error inverse autocorrelation function graphics.

arguments.name: WN
arguments.description: Plots white noise graphics.

arguments.name: MODELS
arguments.description: Plots model graphics.

arguments.name: FORECASTS
arguments.description: Plots forecast graphics.

arguments.name: MODELFORECASTSONLY
arguments.description: Plots forecast graphics with confidence limits in the data range.

arguments.name: FORECASTSONLY
arguments.description: Plots the forecast in the forecast horizon only.

arguments.name: LEVELS
arguments.description: Plots smoothed level component graphics.

arguments.name: SEASONS
arguments.description: Plots smoothed seasonal component graphics.

arguments.name: TRENDS
arguments.description: Plots smoothed trend (slope) component graphics.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Specifies all available PLOT= options

arguments.name: PRINT=
arguments.description: Specifies the printed output desired. By default, the ESM procedure produces no printed output.
arguments.help: PRINT=ESTIMATES | FORECASTS | PERFORMANCE | PERFORMANCESUMMARY | PERFORMANCEOVERALL | STATISTICS | STATES | SUMMARY | ALL

arguments.name: ESTIMATES
arguments.description: Prints the results of parameter estimation.

arguments.name: FORECASTS
arguments.description: Prints the forecasts.

arguments.name: PERFORMANCE
arguments.description: Prints the performance statistics for each forecast.

arguments.name: PERFORMANCESUMMARY
arguments.description: Prints the performance summary for each BY group.

arguments.name: PERFORMANCEOVERALL
arguments.description: Prints the performance summary for all of the BY groups.

arguments.name: STATISTICS
arguments.description: Prints the statistics of fit.

arguments.name: STATES
arguments.description: Prints the backcast, initial, and final states.

arguments.name: SUMMARY
arguments.description: Prints the summary statistics for the accumulated time series.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Same as PRINT=(ESTIMATES FORECASTS STATISTICS SUMMARY)

arguments.name: PRINTDETAILS
arguments.description: Specifies that output requested with the PRINT= option be printed in greater detail.

arguments.name: SEASONALITY=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the seasonal cycle. For example, SEASONALITY=3 means that every group of three observations forms a seasonal cycle. The SEASONALITY= option is applicable only for seasonal forecasting models. By default, the length of the seasonal cycle is one (no seasonality) or the length implied by the INTERVAL= option specified in the ID statement.

arguments.name: SORTNAMES
arguments.description: Specifies that the variables specified in the FORECAST statements are processed in sorted order.

arguments.name: STARTSUM=
arguments.description: Specifies the starting forecast lead (or horizon) for which to begin summation of the forecasts specified by the LEAD= option. The STARTSUM= value must be less than the LEAD= value. The default is STARTSUM=1; that is, the sum from the one-step ahead forecast (which is the first forecast in the forecast horizon) to the multistep forecast specified by the LEAD= option.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: A BY statement can be used with PROC ESM to obtain separate dummy variable definitions for groups of observations defined by the BY variables.

statements.name: FORECAST
statements.description: The FORECAST statement lists the numeric variables in the DATA= data set whose accumulated values represent time series to be modeled and forecast. The options specify which forecast model is to be used.

arguments.name: ACCUMULATE=
arguments.description: Specifies how the data set observations are accumulated within each time period. The frequency (width of each time interval) is specified by the INTERVAL= option.
arguments.help: ACCUMULATE=NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | N | NMISS | NOBS | FIRST | LAST | STDDEV | CSS | USS

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No accumulation occurs; the ID variable values must be equally spaced with respect to the frequency. This is the default option.

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the total sum of their values.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the average of their values.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the minimum of their values.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the median of their values.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the maximum of their values.

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of nonmissing observations.

arguments.name: NMISS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of missing observations.

arguments.name: NOBS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the number of observations.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the first of their values.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the last of their values.

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the standard deviation of their values.

arguments.name: CSS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the corrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: USS
arguments.description: Observations are accumulated based on the uncorrected sum of squares of their values.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the significance level to use in computing the confidence limits of the forecast. The ALPHA= value must be between 0 and 1. The default is ALPHA=0.05, which produces 95% confidence intervals.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the median forecast values are to be estimated. Forecasts can be based on the mean or median. By default, the mean value is provided. If no transformation is applied to the time series by using the TRANSFORM= option, the mean and median forecast values are identical.

arguments.name: MODEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the forecasting model to be used to forecast the time series. The default is MODEL=SIMPLE, which performs simple exponential smoothing.
arguments.help: MODEL=NONE | SIMPLE | DOUBLE | LINEAR | DAMPTREND | ADDSEASONAL | MULTSEASONAL | WINTERS | ADDWINTERS

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No forecast

arguments.name: SIMPLE
arguments.description: Simple (single) exponential smoothing. This is the default.

arguments.name: DOUBLE
arguments.description: Double (Brown) exponential smoothing

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: Linear (Holt) exponential smoothing

arguments.name: DAMPTREND
arguments.description: Damped trend exponential smoothing

arguments.name: ADDSEASONAL
arguments.description: Additive seasonal exponential smoothing

arguments.name: MULTSEASONAL
arguments.description: Multiplicative seasonal exponential smoothing

arguments.name: WINTERS
arguments.description: Winters multiplicative method

arguments.name: ADDWINTERS
arguments.description: Winters additive method

arguments.name: NBACKCAST=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of observations used to initialize the backcast states. The default is the entire series.

arguments.name: REPLACEBACK
arguments.description: Specifies that actual values excluded by the BACK= option are replaced with one-step-ahead forecasts in the OUT= data set.

arguments.name: REPLACEMISSING
arguments.description: Specifies that embedded missing values are replaced with one-step-ahead forecasts in the OUT= data set.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values (either input or accumulated) are assigned in the accumulated time series. If a number n is specified (SETMISSING=n), missing values are set to that number.
arguments.help: SETMISSING=MISSING | AVERAGE | MINIMUM | MEDIAN | MAXIMUM | FIRST | LAST | PREVIOUS | NEXT

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Missing values are set to missing. This is the default option.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated average value.

arguments.name: MINIMUM
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated minimum value.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated median value.

arguments.name: MAXIMUM
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated maximum value.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated first nonmissing value.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the accumulated last nonmissing value.

arguments.name: PREVIOUS
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the previous accumulated nonmissing value. Missing values at the beginning of the accumulated series remain missing.

arguments.name: NEXT
arguments.description: Missing values are set to the next accumulated nonmissing value. Missing values at the end of the accumulated series remain missing.

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: Specifies the time series transformation to be applied to the input or accumulated time series.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No transformation. This is the default.

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Logarithmic transformation

arguments.name: SQRT
arguments.description: Square-root transformation

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Logistic transformation

arguments.name: BOXCOX
arguments.description: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5.

arguments.name: USE=
arguments.description: Specifies which forecast values are appended to the actual values in the OUT= and OUTSUM= data sets.

arguments.name: PREDICT
arguments.description: The predicted values are appended to the actual values. This option is the default.

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: The lower confidence limit values are appended to the actual values.

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: The upper confidence limit values are appended to the actual values.

arguments.name: ZEROMISS=
arguments.description: Specifies how beginning and/or ending zero values (either input or accumulated) are interpreted in the accumulated time series.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Beginning and/or ending zeros are unchanged. This is the default.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: Beginning zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: Ending zeros are set to missing.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Both beginning and ending zeros are set to missing.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the input and output data sets. The ID variable’s values are assumed to be SAS date or datetime values. In addition, the ID statement specifies the (desired) frequency associated with the time series. The ID statement options also specify how the observations are accumulated and how the time ID values are aligned to form the time series to be forecast.
statements.help: ID <ACCUMULATE=<NONE | TOTAL | AVERAGE>... > <ALIGN=<BEGINNING | MIDDLE | ENDING>> <END=date | datetime> ...

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAS format for the time ID values. If the FORMAT= option is not specified, the default format is implied from the INTERVAL= option.
